title: Keystone Technologies Publishes Guide to Value-Based Care
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/24/2015 @ 5:30 AM   Keystone Technologies 
ST. LOUIS, MO--(Marketwired - September 24, 2015) - Keystone Technologies, an industry innovator in senior care technology solutions, today announced that it has teamed with Iowa-based Western Home Communities to publish a guide detailing the future of value-based care within the senior care space. The e-book, The Senior Living Operator's Guide: Making the Shift to Value-Based Care, is available for free download at http://www.keystone-technologies.com/making-the-shift-to-value-based-care-guide . 
Over the past few years, value-based care -- a pay-for-performance approach that aims to reduce costs by emphasizing preventative care and efficiency -- has emerged as a driving force in the future of healthcare payment structures. However, the move to value-based care is so new that predicting how it will affect the senior care industry is difficult. The new guide from Keystone Technologies and Western Home Communities examines this rapidly evolving strategy and how senior care operators can successfully prepare for the inevitable adoption of value-based care. Among the e-book's features: Why the established approach of volume-based care is inefficient in today's environment An explanation of the "triple aim" that is at the heart of value-based care The role of accountable care organizations, or ACOs, in the future of value-based care How value-based care compares with volume-based care Four key considerations when shifting to value-based care 
"For certain, value-based care will impact how senior care will be provided in the future," says Andy Belval, President and CEO of Keystone Technologies. "This pay-for-performance approach likely will be required by federal and private payers, and will carry penalties for those organizations that do not participate. We have teamed with Kris Hansen from Western Home Communities to offer important information to senior care operators on the inevitable change to value-based care. Our guide will help operators make the most of this opportunity to position their organizations for success immediately and into the future." 
For more information about this new e-book or Keystone Technologies' innovative senior care solutions, visit the company's website at http://www.keystone-technologies.com . 
About Keystone Technologies Keystone Technologies provides solutions to help senior care communities offer the highest quality of life and care to their residents. The company's Keystone Care solution offers sensor-based health monitoring and artificial intelligence technology installed in seniors' living spaces that alerts care providers to warning signs of many negative health events. Keystone Connect delivers a user-friendly software portal that acts as a home base for all residents' communication, engagement, and entertainment needs. Keystone Core is a comprehensive IT infrastructure service to ensure senior care communities' applications function efficiently and effectively. Based in St. Louis, Keystone Technologies is dedicated to improving the life of all seniors -- one life at a time. For more information, visit http://www.keystone-technologies.com . 
About Western Home Communities Western Home Communities is a charitable Christian service organization that assertively creates fulfilling lifestyles for seniors, their families, and our employees. Established more than a century ago, Western Home operates active retirement, standard care, and memory care facilities in Cedar Falls, Iowa. Also, SureCare Services of Western Home Communities, started in 1994, delivers 1,500 hours of companion care per week including housekeeping, laundry, and transportation services.
